title: Latest Developments in Post-FIB Concentrated Ar Ion Beam Milling of TEM Specimens with Large Electron-transparent Areas
content: Post-FIB Ar ion milling is an effective technique for final specimen thinning and for removing amorphization damage and ion-implanted layers that are present in specimens prepared by Ga FIB [1-3] and in Xe plasma FIB [4]. The effectiveness of post-FIB concentrated Ar ion milling [NanoMill® and PicoMill® TEM specimen preparation systems, Fischione Instruments] as a final thinning step is attributed to ultra-low ion beam energies of less than 2 kV and a concentrated Ar ion beam that is less than 1 µm diameter [1-3, 5]. Final thinning of the specimen following FIB or pFIB milling is typically performed in the NanoMill and PicoMill systems with specimen tilts of +12°/-10° [5].
